nodes.label: C3 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: Photosynthesis pathway in plants where CO2 is fixed into a 3-carbon compound. Dominated by Rubisco capacity at low temperatures and low CO2.

nodes.label: C4 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: Photosynthesis pathway in plants that efficiently fix CO2 into a 4-carbon compound. Rubisco limits photosynthesis below 20°C in some species.

nodes.label: Rubisco
nodes.description: Ribulose-1,5-bisphosphate carboxylase/oxygenase, an enzyme critical for carbon fixation in photosynthesis. Its capacity limits photosynthesis at low temperatures.

nodes.label: Rubisco Activase
nodes.description: An enzyme that activates Rubisco. Its stability is affected by temperature, influencing photosynthetic efficiency.

nodes.label: Pi Regeneration
nodes.description: The process of regenerating inorganic phosphate (Pi) necessary for the Calvin cycle. Becomes a limitation at higher temperatures.

nodes.label: Electron Transport
nodes.description: The process of transferring electrons through a series of proteins in the thylakoid membrane, crucial for ATP and NADPH production.

nodes.label: Thermal Optimum
nodes.description: The temperature range at which photosynthesis is maximized. Varies with species and acclimation conditions.

nodes.label: Acclimation
nodes.description: The process by which plants adjust their physiological processes to cope with changing environmental conditions, such as temperature.

nodes.label: Cold-adapted Plants
nodes.description: Plants that thrive in cooler temperatures, typically showing optimal photosynthesis between 0–30°C.

nodes.label: Warm-season Crops
nodes.description: Crops that grow best in warmer temperatures, with optimal photosynthesis between 7–40°C.

nodes.label: Tropical/Desert Species
nodes.description: Plants adapted to hot climates, with optimal photosynthesis between 15–45°C.

nodes.label: Global Change
nodes.description: Changes in climate patterns affecting ecosystems, expected to shift photosynthetic limitations towards electron transport and Rubisco activase.

nodes.label: High CO2 Conditions
nodes.description: Increased atmospheric CO2 levels, which can influence photosynthetic processes and limitations.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Limitations
nodes.description: Factors that restrict the rate of photosynthesis, including Rubisco capacity, Pi regeneration, and electron transport.

nodes.label: Chilling-tolerant Species
nodes.description: Plant species that can tolerate low temperatures, where Rubisco limits photosynthesis below 20°C.

nodes.label: Rubisco and C4 Cycle Enzymes
nodes.description: Enzymes involved in the C4 photosynthetic pathway that increase in response to cooler acclimation conditions.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Efficiency
nodes.description: The effectiveness of photosynthesis in converting light energy into chemical energy, influenced by temperature and acclimation.

nodes.label: Plant Productivity
nodes.description: The overall yield of biomass produced by plants, affected by photosynthetic efficiency and environmental conditions.

nodes.label: Temperature Response
nodes.description: The reaction of plants to changes in temperature, crucial for understanding photosynthesis under climate change.

nodes.label: Modeling and Experimental Methods
nodes.description: Techniques used to study plant responses to temperature, improving understanding of photosynthesis under varying conditions.

edges.label: Rubisco capacity limits photosynthesis at low temperatures

Electron transport limitations occur at high temperatures

Photosynthetic efficiency is influenced by C3 photosynthesis
Plant productivity is affected by photosynthetic efficiency
